verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> gathered together<WH622> their armies<WH4264> to battle;<WH4421> and they were gathered together<WH622> at Socoh,<WH7755> which belongs to Judah,<WH3063> and encamped<WH2583> between Socoh<WH7755> and Azekah,<WH5825> in Ephesdammim.<WH658>

Saul<WH7586> and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> were gathered together,<WH622> and encamped<WH2583> in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> and set the battle<WH4421> in array<WH6186> against<WH7125> the Philistines.<WH6430>
The Philistines<WH6430> stood<WH5975> on the mountain<WH2022> on the one side,<WH3478> and Israel stood<WH5975> on the mountain<WH2022> on the other side:<WH1516> and there was a valley between them.

There went out<WH3318> a champion<WH376> out of the camp<WH4264> of the Philistines,<WH6430> named<WH8034> Goliath,<WH1555> of Gath,<WH1661> whose height<WH1363> was six<WH8337> cubits<WH520> and a span.<WH2239>

He had a helmet<WH3553> of brass<WH5178> on his head,<WH7218> and he was clad<WH3847> with a coat<WH8302> of mail;<WH7193> and the weight<WH4948> of the coat<WH8302> was five<WH2568> thousand<WH505> shekels<WH8255> of brass.<WH5178>
He had brass<WH5178> shin armor<WH4697> on his legs,<WH7272> and a javelin<WH3591> of brass<WH5178> between his shoulders.<WH3802>

The staff<WH6086> of his spear<WH2595> was like a weaver<WH707>'s beam;<WH4500> and his spear<WH2595>'s head<WH3852> weighed six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of iron:<WH1270> and his shield<WH6793> bearer<WH5375> went<WH1980> before him.<WH6440>

He stood<WH5975> and cried<WH7121> to the armies<WH4634> of Israel,<WH3478> and said<WH559> to them,<WH3318> "Why have you come out to set your battle<WH4421> in array?<WH6186> Am I not a Philistine,<WH6430> and you servants<WH5650> to Saul?<WH7586> Choose<WH1262> a man<WH376> for yourselves,<WH3381> and let him come down to me.

If he be able<WH3201> to fight<WH3898> with me,<WH5221> and kill me,<WH5650> then will we be your servants; but if I prevail<WH3201> against him,<WH5221> and kill him,<WH5650> then you will be our servants, and serve us.<WH5647>"
The Philistine<WH6430> said,<WH559> "I defy<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of Israel<WH3478> this day!<WH3117> Give<WH5414> me a man,<WH376> that we may fight<WH3898> together!<WH3162>"
When Saul<WH7586> and all Israel<WH3478> heard<WH8085> those words<WH1697> of the Philistine,<WH6430> they were dismayed,<WH2865> and greatly<WH3966> afraid.<WH3372>

Now David<WH1732> was the son<WH1121> of that Ephrathite<WH376> of Bethlehem Judah,<WH1035> whose name<WH8034> was Jesse;<WH3448> and he had eight<WH8083> sons:<WH1121> and the man<WH376> was<WH935> an old man<WH2204> in the days<WH3117> of Saul,<WH7586> stricken among men.<WH582>

The three<WH7969> eldest<WH1419> sons<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> had gone<WH3212> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586> to the battle:<WH4421> and the names<WH8034> of his three<WH7969> sons<WH1121> who went<WH1980> to the battle<WH4421> were Eliab<WH446> the firstborn,<WH1060> and next<WH4932> to him Abinadab,<WH41> and the third<WH7992> Shammah.<WH8048>
David<WH1732> was the youngest;<WH6996> and the three<WH7969> eldest<WH1419> followed<WH1980> Saul.<WH7586>
Now David<WH1732> went<WH1980> back and forth<WH7725> from Saul<WH7586> to feed<WH7462> his father<WH1>'s sheep<WH6629> at Bethlehem.<WH1035>
The Philistine<WH6430> drew near<WH5066> morning<WH7925> and evening,<WH6150> and presented<WH3320> himself forty<WH705> days.<WH3117>

Jesse<WH3448> said<WH559> to David<WH1732> his son,<WH1121> "Now take<WH3947> for your brothers<WH251> an ephah<WH374> of this<WH2088> parched<WH7039> grain,<WH6235> and these ten loaves,<WH3899> and carry<WH7323> them quickly to the camp<WH4264> to your brothers;<WH251>
and bring<WH935> these ten<WH6235> cheeses<WH2461> to the captain<WH8269> of their thousand,<WH505> and see<WH6485> how your brothers<WH251> are doing,<WH7965> and bring<WH3947> back news.<WH6161>"
Now Saul,<WH7586> and they,<WH376> and all the men of Israel,<WH3478> were in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> fighting<WH3898> with the Philistines.<WH6430>

David<WH1732> rose up early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and left<WH5203> the sheep<WH6629> with a keeper,<WH8104> and took,<WH5375> and went,<WH3212> as Jesse<WH3448> had commanded<WH6680> him;<WH935> and he came to the place<WH4570> of the wagons,<WH2428> as the army which was going forth<WH3318> to the fight<WH4634> shouted<WH7321> for the battle.<WH4421>
Israel<WH3478> and the Philistines<WH6430> put the battle in array,<WH6186> army<WH4634> against<WH7125> army.<WH4634>

David<WH1732> left<WH5203> his baggage<WH3627> in the hand<WH3027> of the keeper<WH8104> of the baggage,<WH3627> and ran<WH7323> to the army,<WH4634> and came<WH935> and greeted<WH7592> his brothers.<WH251>

As he talked<WH1696> with them,<WH5927> behold, there came up the champion,<WH376> the Philistine<WH6430> of Gath,<WH1661> Goliath<WH1555> by name,<WH8034> out of the ranks<WH4634> of the Philistines,<WH6430> and spoke<WH1696> according to the same<WH428> words:<WH1697> and David<WH1732> heard them.<WH8085>
All the men<WH376> of Israel,<WH3478> when they saw<WH7200> the man,<WH376> fled<WH5127> from him,<WH6440> and were<WH3966> terrified.<WH3372>

The men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> "Have you seen<WH7200> this man<WH376> who has come up?<WH5927> He has surely come up<WH5927> to defy<WH2778> Israel.<WH3478> It shall be,<WH376> that the man who kills<WH5221> him,<WH4428> the king will enrich<WH6238> him with great<WH1419> riches,<WH6239> and will give<WH5414> him his daughter,<WH1323> and make<WH6213> his father<WH1>'s house<WH1004> free<WH2670> in Israel.<WH3478>"

David<WH1732> spoke<WH559> to the men<WH582> who stood<WH5975> by him,<WH559> saying, "What shall be done<WH6213> to the man<WH376> who kills<WH5221> this<WH1975> Philistine,<WH6430> and takes away<WH5493> the reproach<WH2781> from Israel?<WH3478> For who is this uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine,<WH6430> that he should defy<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God?<WH430>"
The people<WH5971> answered<WH559> him in this way,<WH1697> saying,<WH559> "So shall it be done<WH6213> to the man<WH376> who kills him.<WH5221>"

Eliab<WH446> his eldest<WH1419> brother<WH251> heard<WH8085> when he spoke<WH1696> to the men;<WH582> and Eliab<WH446>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against David,<WH1732> and he said,<WH559> "Why have you come down?<WH3381> With whom have you left<WH5203> those<WH2007> few<WH4592> sheep<WH6629> in the wilderness?<WH4057> I know<WH3045> your pride,<WH2087> and the naughtiness<WH7455> of your heart;<WH3824> for you have come down<WH3381> that you might see<WH7200> the battle.<WH4421>"
David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "What have I now done?<WH6213> Is there not a cause?<WH1697>"
He turned<WH5437> away from him<WH681> toward<WH4136> another,<WH312> and spoke<WH559> like that again;<WH1697> and the people<WH5971> answered<WH1697> him again<WH7725> the same<WH7223> way.<WH1697>
When the words<WH1697> were heard<WH8085> which David<WH1732> spoke,<WH1696> they rehearsed<WH5046> them before<WH6440> Saul;<WH7586> and he sent for him.<WH3947>
David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Let no man<WH120>'s heart<WH3820> fail<WH5307> because of him.<WH5650> Your servant will go<WH3212> and fight<WH3898> with this Philistine.<WH6430>"

Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are not able<WH3201> to go<WH3212> against this Philistine<WH6430> to fight<WH3898> with him;<WH5288> for you are but a youth, and he a man<WH376> of war<WH4421> from his youth.<WH5271>"

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Your servant<WH5650> was keeping<WH7462> his father<WH1>'s sheep;<WH6629> and when a lion<WH738> or a bear<WH1677> came,<WH935> and took<WH5375> a lamb<WH7716> out of the flock,<WH5739>

I went out<WH3318> after<WH310> him,<WH5221> and struck him,<WH5337> and rescued it out of his mouth.<WH6310> When he arose<WH6965> against me,<WH2388> I caught him by his beard,<WH2206> and struck<WH5221> him,<WH4191> and killed him.

Your servant<WH5650> struck<WH5221> both the lion<WH738> and the bear.<WH1677> This uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine<WH6430> shall be as one<WH259> of them,<WH2778> since he has defied the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God.<WH430>"

David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "Yahweh<WH3068> who delivered<WH5337> me out of the paw<WH3027> of the lion,<WH738> and out of the paw<WH3027> of the bear,<WH1677> he will deliver<WH5337> me out of the hand<WH3027> of this Philistine.<WH6430>" Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Go;<WH3212> and Yahweh shall be with you.<WH3068>"
Saul<WH7586> dressed<WH3847> David<WH1732> with his clothing.<WH4055> He put<WH5414> a helmet<WH6959> of brass<WH5178> on his head,<WH7218> and he clad<WH3847> him with a coat of mail.<WH8302>

David<WH1732> strapped<WH2296> his sword<WH2719> on his clothing,<WH4055> and he tried<WH2974> to move;<WH3212> for he had not tested<WH5254> it.<WH1732> David said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "I can't<WH3201> go<WH3212> with these;<WH3201> for I have not tested<WH5254> them.<WH1732>" David took them off.

He took<WH3947> his staff<WH4731> in his hand,<WH3027> and chose<WH977> for himself five<WH2568> smooth<WH2512> stones<WH68> out of the brook,<WH5158> and put<WH7760> them in the shepherd<WH7462>'s bag<WH3627> which he had,<WH3219> even in his wallet. His sling<WH7050> was in his hand;<WH3027> and he drew near<WH5066> to the Philistine.<WH6430>
The Philistine<WH6430> came<WH3212> on<WH1980> and drew near<WH7131> to David;<WH1732> and the man<WH376> who bore<WH5375> the shield<WH6793> went before him.<WH6440>
When the Philistine<WH6430> looked about,<WH5027> and saw<WH7200> David,<WH1732> he disdained<WH959> him;<WH5288> for he was but a youth, and ruddy,<WH132> and withal of a fair<WH3303> face.<WH4758>
The Philistine<WH6430> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Am I a dog,<WH3611> that you come<WH935> to me with sticks?<WH4731>" The Philistine<WH6430> cursed<WH7043> David<WH1732> by his gods.<WH430>

The Philistine<WH6430> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Come<WH3212> to me,<WH5414> and I will give your flesh<WH1320> to the birds<WH5775> of the sky,<WH8064> and to the animals<WH929> of the field.<WH7704>"

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to the Philistine,<WH6430> "You come<WH935> to me with a sword,<WH2719> and with a spear,<WH2595> and with a javelin:<WH3591> but I come<WH935> to you in the name<WH8034> of Yahweh<WH3068> of Armies,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of the armies<WH6635> of Israel,<WH3478> whom you have defied.<WH2778>

Today,<WH3117> Yahweh<WH3068> will deliver<WH5462> you into my hand.<WH3027> I will strike<WH5221> you,<WH5493> and take your head<WH7218> from off you.<WH5414> I will give the dead bodies<WH6297> of the army<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> this day<WH3117> to the birds<WH5775> of the sky,<WH8064> and to the wild animals<WH2416> of the earth;<WH776> that all the earth<WH776> may know<WH3045> that there is<WH3426> a God<WH430> in Israel,<WH3478>

and that all this assembly<WH6951> may know<WH3045> that Yahweh<WH3068> doesn't<WH3467> save with sword<WH2719> and spear:<WH2595> for the battle<WH4421> is Yahweh<WH3068>'s, and he will give<WH5414> you into our hand.<WH3027>"

It happened,<WH6430> when the Philistine arose,<WH6965> and came<WH3212> and drew near<WH7126> to meet<WH7125> David,<WH1732> that David<WH1732> hurried,<WH4116> and ran<WH7323> toward the army<WH4634> to meet<WH7125> the Philistine.<WH6430>

David<WH1732> put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> in his bag,<WH3627> took<WH3947> a stone,<WH68> and slung<WH7049> it,<WH5221> and struck the Philistine<WH6430> in his forehead;<WH4696> and the stone<WH68> sank<WH2883> into his forehead,<WH4696> and he fell<WH5307> on his face<WH6440> to the earth.<WH776>

So David<WH1732> prevailed<WH2388> over<WH4480> the Philistine<WH6430> with a sling<WH7050> and with a stone,<WH68> and struck<WH5221> the Philistine,<WH6430> and killed<WH4191> him;<WH2719> but there was no sword in the hand<WH3027> of David.<WH1732>

Then David<WH1732> ran,<WH7323> and stood<WH5975> over the Philistine,<WH6430> and took<WH3947> his sword,<WH2719> and drew<WH8025> it out of its sheath,<WH8593> and killed<WH4191> him,<WH3772> and cut off his head<WH7218> therewith.<WH6430> When the Philistines saw<WH7200> that their champion<WH1368> was dead,<WH4191> they fled.<WH5127>

The men<WH582> of Israel<WH3478> and of Judah<WH3063> arose,<WH6965> and shouted,<WH7321> and pursued<WH7291> the Philistines,<WH6430> until you come<WH935> to Gai,<WH1516> and to the gates<WH8179> of Ekron.<WH6138> The wounded<WH2491> of the Philistines<WH6430> fell down<WH5307> by the way<WH1870> to Shaaraim,<WH8189> even to Gath,<WH1661> and to Ekron.<WH6138>
The children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> returned<WH7725> from chasing<WH1814> after<WH310> the Philistines,<WH6430> and they plundered<WH8155> their camp.<WH4264>
David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the head<WH7218> of the Philistine,<WH6430> and brought<WH935> it to Jerusalem;<WH3389> but he put<WH7760> his armor<WH3627> in his tent.<WH168>

When Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> David<WH1732> go forth<WH3318> against<WH7125> the Philistine,<WH6430> he said<WH559> to Abner,<WH74> the captain<WH8269> of the army,<WH6635> "Abner,<WH74> whose son<WH1121> is this youth?<WH5288>" Abner<WH74> said,<WH559> "As your soul<WH5315> lives,<WH2416> O king,<WH4428> I can't<WH518> tell.<WH3045>"
The king<WH4428> said,<WH559> "Inquire<WH7592> whose son<WH1121> the young man is!<WH5958>"

As David<WH1732> returned<WH7725> from the slaughter<WH5221> of the Philistine,<WH6430> Abner<WH74> took<WH3947> him,<WH935> and brought him before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586> with the head<WH7218> of the Philistine<WH6430> in his hand.<WH3027>

Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to him,<WH1121> "Whose son are you,<WH5288> you young man?" David<WH1732> answered,<WH559> "I am the son<WH1121> of your servant<WH5650> Jesse<WH3448> the Bethlehemite.<WH1022>"
